title: 115_s2364
content: The Act is titled the "Securing Required Funding for Water Infrastructure Now Act" or the "SRF WIN Act." It amends the Water Infrastructure Finance and Innovation Act of 2014 to include innovative financing for state loan funds. The "SRF WIN Act" amends the Water Infrastructure Finance and Innovation Act of 2014 to provide financial assistance to State loan funds for water and wastewater infrastructure projects. Eligible activities include those carried out by State infrastructure financing authorities. Financial assistance under this section can be used for activities in the intended use plan of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act and the project priority list of the Safe Drinking Water Act. It can also cover administrative costs and application fees are waived. The Administrator considers projects based on intended use plans. State authorities can use financial assistance for activities in the plan. Requirements and procedures apply, with exceptions for interest rates. The interest rate for secured loans under this section is tied to the yield on US Treasury securities of similar maturity at the time of the loan agreement. In certain states, the rate can be 80% of the standard rate. The Administrator may provide a secured loan at an interest rate between 50% and 80% of the standard rate if there is insufficient demand for loans. This applies to states receiving less than 2% of total funds. The President may declare a major disaster for secured loans related to wastewater or drinking water projects during a specific period. The President may declare a major disaster for secured loans related to wastewater or drinking water projects. Funds will be distributed for secured loans at different interest rates to States affected by the disaster. The Administrator may reallocate funds for loans to meet applicant demand. Projects must comply with State environmental or engineering review requirements. The section outlines specific regulations that projects must comply with, including sections of the Safe Drinking Water Act and the Code of Federal Regulations. It clarifies that no new reviews are required for projects under this section, and financial assistance can cover up to 100% of project costs. The section authorizes financial assistance to support loans up to $7 billion per state for projects from 2019 to 2023. An expedited review process is required within 180 days of receiving a complete application. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the Administrator to carry out the program. The Administrator is authorized to receive $200,000,000 annually from 2019 to 2023 for this program. Congress supports $10,000,000,000 in secured loans at one interest rate and $850,000,000 in secured loans at another interest rate each fiscal year. Administrative costs can be covered from the funds allocated for the program. The Administrator may use up to $5,000,000 annually from 2019 to 2023 for technical assistance to aid State infrastructure financing authorities. Additionally, funds can be used for processing and reviewing applications, including underwriting costs, for the same fiscal years. The funds allocated for State loan funds in 2023 will be used instead of collected fees. No funds will be provided if the total amount for State loan funds or assistance is less than in fiscal year 2018. Distribution and allotment of funds will be determined accordingly. In distributing funds between State loan funds, the Administrator will prioritize financial assistance based on need and give equal consideration to drinking water and wastewater projects. Projects will be selected based on need, and the authority to provide assistance under this section will end on September 30, 2023.
